Class LadderAndSnake

java.lang.Object
LadderAndSnake
public class LadderAndSnake extends Object
The LadderAndSnake class . This class includes the crucial methods needed to play the game. These methods include: play, doesPlayerWin, playerMove, doesPlayerWin, toString, etc.
Author:
Ambrose McLaughlin

    LadderAndSnake(ArrayList<Player> players)
    Parameterized constructor that defines the gameBoard using rows and collumns, sets snakes and ladders, and verifies the number of players.

  • Constructor Details

    • LadderAndSnake

  • Method Details

    • doesPlayerWin

      public boolean doesPlayerWin(Player player, int number)
      Method that checks whether or not the position a player occupies is the winning position. If a player rolls a dice value that sends the player beyond the 100 position, this method will also send them backwards by the excess amount. theMethod landedOnPlayer is called in this method.
      Parameters:
      Player - player corresponding to the player currently playing.
      Integer - number representing the player's position.
      Returns:
      a boolean value representing whether or not a player has reached position 100.

    • landedOnPlayer

      public void landedOnPlayer(Player movingPlayer)
      Checks to see if a player lands on a position already occupied by another player. If the above is so, the player who occupied the contested position initially will have their position set to 0.
      Parameters:
      Player - movingPlayer corresponding to the player currently playing.

    • playerMove

      public boolean playerMove(Player player, int number)
      Method responsible for incrementing the position of player. This method will also check to see if the players position corresponds to the starting point of a ladder or snake, as well as send them to the ladder or snakes respective ending position. Also applies the doesPlayerWin to check if the player's position ever reaches 100.
      Parameters:
      Player - player
      Integer - number
      Returns:
      the result of the doesPlayerWin method based on the players position

    • setSnakes

      public void setSnakes()
      Defines the starting and ending position of 8 snakes

    • setLadders

      public void setLadders()

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Checks to see if a player lands on as position already occupied by another player. If the above is so, the player who occupied the contested position initially will have their position set to 0.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string corresponding to a visual representation of the game board with the current position of players that occupy a position from 1 to 100.

    • play

      public static void play()
      Allows users to play the game. Uses previously defined methods to apply the rules of the game. Welcomes, prompts, updates, and delivers aclosing messagee to users.
